In mullite the T site is of major interest as Al/Si ordering mainly takes place on that site and it participates in both diclusters and triclusters. The displacive modulation functions can be determined for any atomic domain if sufficient coordinates of a specific average structure site are available. Here, there are four independent coordinate triplets for Al3 and O4 and 20 for Al1, O1 and O2. In the present example, meaningful modulation functions can be determined if the observables-to-parameter ratio for the fitting is larger than about 1.5.
